     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí# configure homebrew environment and add to path
     4‚Üíset -gx HOMEBREW_GITHUB_API_TOKEN (security find-internet-password -s api.github.com -w)
     5‚Üíset -gx HOMEBREW_NO_ENV_HINTS 1
     6‚Üíset -gx HOMEBREW_PREFIX "/opt/homebrew";
     7‚Üíset -gx HOMEBREW_CELLAR "/opt/homebrew/Cellar";
     8‚Üíset -gx HOMEBREW_REPOSITORY "/opt/homebrew";
     9‚Üí! set -q PATH; and set PATH ''; set -gx PATH "/opt/homebrew/bin" "/opt/homebrew/sbin" "/opt/homebrew/opt/grep/libexec/gnubin/" $PATH;
    10‚Üí! set -q MANPATH; and set MANPATH ''; set -gx MANPATH "/opt/homebrew/share/man" $MANPATH;
    11‚Üí! set -q INFOPATH; and set INFOPATH ''; set -gx INFOPATH "/opt/homebrew/share/info" $INFOPATH;
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üíset -gx OLLAMA_API_BASE "http://127.0.0.1:11434"

    15‚Üí# work configuration
    16‚Üíif test -d "$HOME/dev/nu"
    17‚Üí  set -gx NU_HOME "$HOME/dev/nu"
    18‚Üí  set -gx PATH $NU_HOME/nucli $NU_HOME/mini-meta-repo/monocli/bin $NU_HOME/sdk-flutter/bin $PATH
    19‚Üíend
    20‚Üí
    21‚Üíif test -d "$HOME/Library/Android/sdk"
    22‚Üí  set -l DROID "$HOME/Library/Android/sdk"
    23‚Üí  set -gx PATH $DROID/platform-tools $DROID/tools $DROID/emulator $DROID/cmdline-tools/latest/bin $PATH
    24‚Üíend
    25‚Üí
    26‚Üí# add home/bin and Doom to path
    27‚Üíset -gx PATH $HOME/bin $HOME/.local/bin $HOME/.config/emacs/bin $HOME/.bun/bin $PATH
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí# ensure ssh and gpg are initialized

    31‚Üíset -x GPG_TTY (tty)
    32‚Üíset -x GPG_AGENT_INFO "~/.gnupg/S.gpg-agent:"(pgrep gpg-agent)":1"
    33‚Üíssh-add -q
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí# configure development environment
    36‚Üíset -gx EDITOR emacs
    37‚Üí
    38‚Üí# envionrment vars per directory
    39‚Üídirenv hook fish | source
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí# 1Password
    42‚Üíset -l opplugins /Users/christian/.config/op/plugins.sh
    43‚Üítest -f $opplugins; and source $opplugins
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí# iTerm2 shell tools (e.g. imgcat)
    46‚Üíset -l itermshell "$HOME/.iterm2_shell_integration.fish"
    47‚Üítest -e $itermshell; and source $itermshell

    49‚Üí# zoxide & fzf

file.content:
set fish_greeting (set_color brmagenta)"[ Û∞à∫ ]"(set_color brgreen)" Welcome back, "(set_color blue)(whoami)(set_color brgreen)"."(set_color normal)

# configure homebrew environment and add to path
set -gx HOMEBREW_GITHUB_API_TOKEN (security find-internet-password -s api.github.com -w)
set -gx HOMEBREW_NO_ENV_HINTS 1
set -gx HOMEBREW_PREFIX "/opt/homebrew";
set -gx HOMEBREW_CELLAR "/opt/homebrew/Cellar";
set -gx HOMEBREW_REPOSITORY "/opt/homebrew";
! set -q PATH; and set PATH ''; set -gx PATH "/opt/homebrew/bin" "/opt/homebrew/sbin" "/opt/homebrew/opt/grep/libexec/gnubin/" $PATH;
! set -q MANPATH; and set MANPATH ''; set -gx MANPATH "/opt/homebrew/share/man" $MANPATH;
! set -q INFOPATH; and set INFOPATH ''; set -gx INFOPATH "/opt/homebrew/share/info" $INFOPATH;

set -gx OLLAMA_API_BASE "http://127.0.0.1:11434"

# work configuration
if test -d "$HOME/dev/nu"
  set -gx NU_HOME "$HOME/dev/nu"
  set -gx PATH $NU_HOME/nucli $NU_HOME/mini-meta-repo/monocli/bin $NU_HOME/sdk-flutter/bin $PATH
end

if test -d "$HOME/Library/Android/sdk"
  set -l DROID "$HOME/Library/Android/sdk"
  set -gx PATH $DROID/platform-tools $DROID/tools $DROID/emulator $DROID/cmdline-tools/latest/bin $PATH
end

# add home/bin and Doom to path
set -gx PATH $HOME/bin $HOME/.local/bin $HOME/.config/emacs/bin $HOME/.bun/bin $PATH

# ensure ssh and gpg are initialized
gpgconf --launch gpg-agent
set -x GPG_TTY (tty)
set -x GPG_AGENT_INFO "~/.gnupg/S.gpg-agent:"(pgrep gpg-agent)":1"
ssh-add -q

# configure development environment
set -gx EDITOR emacs

# envionrment vars per directory
direnv hook fish | source

# 1Password
set -l opplugins /Users/christian/.config/op/plugins.sh
test -f $opplugins; and source $opplugins

# iTerm2 shell tools (e.g. imgcat)
set -l itermshell "$HOME/.iterm2_shell_integration.fish"
test -e $itermshell; and source $itermshell

# zoxide & fzf
zoxide init fish --cmd=cd | source

# configure prompt
if status is-interactive
 starship init fish | source
end

file.content:
format = """
[ÓÇ∂](#4A235A )\
[ Óúë ](bg:#4A235A  fg:#ffffff)\
$username\
$hostname\
[ÓÇ∞](bg:#154360 fg:#4A235A)\
$directory\
[ÓÇ∞](fg:#154360 bg:#1A5276)\
$git_branch\
$git_commit\
$git_state\
$git_status\
$git_metrics\
[ÓÇ∞](fg:#1A5276 bg:#1F618D)\
$python\
$java\
$custom\
[ÓÇ∞](fg:#1F618D bg:#424949)\
$docker_context\
[ÓÇ¥](fg:#424949)\
$line_break\
$battery\
$time\
$character
"""
command_timeout = 3000

# Disable the blank line at the start of the prompt
# add_newline = false

# You can also replace your username with a neat symbol like ÔÑ†  or disable this
# and use the os module below
[username]
show_always = true
style_user = "bg:#4A235A"
style_root = "bg:#CB4335"
format = '[$user]($style)'
disabled = false

[hostname]
disabled = false
ssh_only = false
format = '[@$ssh_symbol$hostname ]($style)'
style = "bg:#4A235A"

[directory]
style = "bg:#154360"
format = "[ $path ]($style)"
truncation_length = 3
truncation_symbol = "‚Ä¶/"

# Here is how you can shorten some long paths by text replacement
# similar to mapped_locations in Oh My Posh:
[directory.substitutions]
"Documents" = "Û∞àô "
"Downloads" = "ÔÄô "
"Music" = "ÔÄÅ "
"Pictures" = "ÔÄæ "

[git_branch]
symbol = "Ôêò"
style = "bg:#1A5276"
format = '[ $symbol](fg:#F39C12  $style)[ $branch ]($style)'

[git_status]
style = "bg:#1A5276"
format = '[$all_status$ahead_behind ]($style)'

[git_commit]
style = "bg:#1A5276"
commit_hash_length = 8

[git_metrics]
added_style = "bg:#1A5276 fg:#58D68D"
deleted_style = "bg:#1A5276 fg:#fC7063"
format = '[‚Å∫$added]($added_style)[¬∑](bg:#1A5276 fg:#ffffff)[$deleted‚Åª]($deleted_style)'
disabled = false

[python]
style = "bg:#1F618D"
symbol = "Óúº "
format = '[ ${symbol}]($style fg:#F1C40F)[(${version} )(\($virtualenv\) )]($style)'

[java]
symbol = "Óâñ "
style = "bg:#1F618D"
format = '[ $symbol]($style fg:#FFC90C)[($version) ]($style)'

[custom.clj]
command = "clojure -version 2>&1 | cut -d' ' -f4"  # shows output of command
ignore_timeout = true
files = ["deps.edn"]       # can specify filters
symbol = "Óù™"
style = "bg:#1F618D"
format = "[$symbol](fg:#58D68D $style)[ $output]($style)"

[docker_context]
symbol = "Û∞°®"
style = "bg:#424949"
format = '[ $symbol](bold fg:#3498DB $style)[ $context ]($style)'

[battery]
full_symbol = "Û∞Åπ "
charging_symbol = "Û∞Çá "

[[battery.display]]
threshold = 60
discharging_symbol = 'Û∞Åø '
style = 'bold green'

[[battery.display]]
threshold = 30
discharging_symbol = 'Û∞Åº '
style = 'bold yellow'

[[battery.display]]
threshold = 15
discharging_symbol = 'Û∞Å∫ '
style = 'bold red'

[[battery.display]]
threshold = 5
discharging_symbol = 'Û∞Çé '
style = 'bold red'

[time]
disabled = false
time_format = "%r" # https://docs.rs/chrono/0.4.7/chrono/format/strftime/index.html
style = "fg:#AF7AC5 " # bg:#33658A style = "bg:"
format = '[ $time ]($style)'

[character]
success_symbol = "[‚Æï](bold fg:#58D68D) "
error_symbol = "[‚Æï](bold fg:#E74C3C) "

content.content:
1‚Üí#!/bin/bash
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí# Claude Code statusline inspired by starship configuration
     4‚Üí# Colors match the starship theme with purple, blue, and green accents
     5‚Üí
     6‚Üí# Parse JSON input
     7‚Üíinput=$(cat)
     8‚Üícwd=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.workspace.current_dir // .cwd')
     9‚Üímodel_name=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.model.display_name')
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí# Color definitions (matching starship theme)
    12‚ÜíPURPLE_BG="\033[48;2;74;35;90m"     # #4A235A
    13‚ÜíBLUE_DARK_BG="\033[48;2;21;67;96m"  # #154360
    14‚ÜíBLUE_DARKER_BG="\033[48;2;15;45;70m"  # #0F2D46 - Much darker blue
    15‚ÜíBLUE_DARKEST_BG="\033[48;2;10;30;50m"  # #0A1E32 - Even darker blue  
    16‚ÜíBLUE_MID_BG="\033[48;2;26;82;118m"  # #1A5276
    17‚ÜíBLUE_LIGHT_BG="\033[48;2;45;125;175m" # #2D7DAF - More contrast with mid blue
    18‚ÜíBLUE_VERY_LIGHT_BG="\033[48;2;70;150;200m" # #4696C8 - Much lighter blue for better contrast
    19‚ÜíGRAY_BG="\033[48;2;66;73;73m"       # #424949
    20‚ÜíWHITE_FG="\033[38;2;255;255;255m"   # white text
    21‚ÜíBOLD_WHITE_FG="\033[1;38;2;255;255;255m" # bold white text
    22‚ÜíBRIGHT_WHITE_FG="\033[1;38;2;255;255;240m" # slightly warm white
    23‚ÜíYELLOW_FG="\033[38;2;241;196;15m"   # #F1C40F
    24‚ÜíGREEN_FG="\033[38;2;88;214;141m"    # #58D68D
    25‚ÜíORANGE_FG="\033[38;2;243;156;18m"   # #F39C12
    26‚ÜíBRIGHT_ORANGE_FG="\033[38;2;255;193;7m" # #FFC107
    27‚ÜíBOLD_BRIGHT_ORANGE_FG="\033[1;38;2;255;165;0m" # Bold #FFA500
    28‚ÜíCUSTOM_BRIGHT_FG="\033[1;38;2;235;224;67m" # Bold RGB(235,224,67)
    29‚ÜíCUSTOM_BRIGHTER_FG="\033[38;2;255;255;100m" # No bold, brighter RGB(255,255,100)
    30‚ÜíCUSTOM_MAX_BRIGHT_FG="\033[1;38;2;255;255;0m" # Bold max bright yellow
    31‚ÜíMAX_YELLOW_NO_BOLD="\033[38;2;255;255;0m" # Max bright yellow without bold
    32‚ÜíFIERY_ORANGE_FG="\033[38;2;255;69;0m" # Fiery orange RGB(255,69,0)
    33‚ÜíBRIGHT_ORANGE_FG2="\033[38;2;255;140;0m" # More orange, less red RGB(255,140,0)
    34‚ÜíPALETTE_BRIGHT_YELLOW="\033[1;38;5;226m" # Bold 256-color bright yellow
    35‚ÜíPALETTE_YELLOW_NO_BOLD="\033[38;5;226m" # 256-color bright yellow without bold
    36‚ÜíPURPLE_FG="\033[38;2;175;122;197m"  # #AF7AC5
    37‚ÜíRED_FG="\033[38;2;231;76;60m"       # #E74C3C
    38‚ÜíRESET="\033[0m"
    39‚Üí
    40‚Üí# Segment separators (Nerd Font powerline glyphs)
    41‚ÜíSEP_RIGHT=$'\uE0B0'  # Nerd Font powerline right separator
    42‚ÜíSEP_LEFT=$'\uE0B2'   # Nerd Font powerline left separator
    43‚Üí# Alternative rounded separators:
    44‚Üí# SEP_RIGHT=$'\uE0B4'  # Nerd Font powerline right separator (rounded)
    45‚Üí# SEP_LEFT=$'\uE0B6'   # Nerd Font powerline left separator (rounded)
    46‚Üí
    47‚Üí# Function to get username and hostname
    48‚Üíget_user_host() {
    49‚Üí    local user=$(whoami)
    50‚Üí    local host=$(hostname -s)
    51‚Üí    printf "${PURPLE_BG}${WHITE_FG}  ${user}@${host} ${RESET}"
    52‚Üí}
    53‚Üí
    54‚Üí# Function to get directory with icon substitutions
    55‚Üíget_directory() {
    56‚Üí    local dir_path="$cwd"
    57‚Üí    local display_path="$dir_path"
    58‚Üí    local nu_indicator=""
    59‚Üí    
    60‚Üí    # Check if we're in a Nubank project
    61‚Üí    if [[ "$dir_path" == *"/dev/nu/"* ]]; then
    62‚Üí        nu_indicator="üè¶ "
    63‚Üí    fi
    64‚Üí    
    65‚Üí    # Apply substitutions similar to starship config
    66‚Üí    display_path=${display_path//$HOME/~}
    67‚Üí    display_path=${display_path//Documents/Û∞àô }
    68‚Üí    display_path=${display_path//Downloads/ }
    69‚Üí    display_path=${display_path//Music/ }
    70‚Üí    display_path=${display_path//Pictures/ }
    71‚Üí    
    72‚Üí    # Truncate long paths
    73‚Üí    if [[ ${#display_path} -gt 50 ]]; then
    74‚Üí        display_path="‚Ä¶/${display_path##*/}"
    75‚Üí    fi
    76‚Üí    
    77‚Üí    printf "${BLUE_MID_BG}${WHITE_FG} ${nu_indicator}${display_path} ${RESET}${BLUE_LIGHT_BG}\033[38;2;26;82;118m${SEP_RIGHT}${RESET}"
    78‚Üí}
    79‚Üí
    80‚Üí# Function to get git information
    81‚Üíget_git_info() {
    82‚Üí    if [[ ! -d "$cwd/.git" ]] && ! git -C "$cwd" rev-parse --git-dir >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    83‚Üí        return
    84‚Üí    fi
    85‚Üí    
    86‚Üí    local branch=$(git -C "$cwd" branch --show-current 2>/dev/null || echo "detached")
    87‚Üí    local status_info=""
    88‚Üí    
    89‚Üí    # Get git status without locks
    90‚Üí    local git_status=$(git -C "$cwd" status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)
    91‚Üí    if [[ -n "$git_status" ]]; then
    92‚Üí        local modified=$(echo "$git_status" | grep -c "^ M\| M\|^M ")
    93‚Üí        local added=$(echo "$git_status" | grep -c "^A \|^M ")
    94‚Üí        local deleted=$(echo "$git_status" | grep -c "^D \| D")
    95‚Üí        local untracked=$(echo "$git_status" | grep -c "^??")
    96‚Üí        
    97‚Üí        [[ $modified -gt 0 ]] && status_info+="!$modified"
    98‚Üí        [[ $added -gt 0 ]] && status_info+="+$added"
    99‚Üí        [[ $deleted -gt 0 ]] && status_info+="-$deleted"
   100‚Üí        [[ $untracked -gt 0 ]] && status_info+="?$untracked"
   101‚Üí    fi
   102‚Üí    
   103‚Üí    # Get ahead/behind info
   104‚Üí    local ahead_behind=$(git -C "$cwd" rev-list --left-right --count HEAD...@{upstream} 2>/dev/null || echo "0 0")
   105‚Üí    local ahead=$(echo "$ahead_behind" | cut -d' ' -f1)
   106‚Üí    local behind=$(echo "$ahead_behind" | cut -d' ' -f2)
   107‚Üí    
   108‚Üí    [[ $ahead -gt 0 ]] && status_info+="‚Üë$ahead"
   109‚Üí    [[ $behind -gt 0 ]] && status_info+="‚Üì$behind"
   110‚Üí    
   111‚Üí    printf "${BLUE_LIGHT_BG}${WHITE_FG} Ôêò $branch "
   112‚Üí    [[ -n "$status_info" ]] && printf "${WHITE_FG}[$status_info] "
   113‚Üí    printf "${RESET}${BLUE_VERY_LIGHT_BG}\033[38;2;45;125;175m${SEP_RIGHT}${RESET}"
   114‚Üí}
   115‚Üí
   116‚Üí# Function to detect and show language versions
   117‚Üíget_language_info() {
   118‚Üí    local lang_info=""
   119‚Üí    
   120‚Üí    # Check for Clojure (prioritized for this project)
   121‚Üí    if [[ -f "$cwd/deps.edn" ]] || [[ -f "$cwd/project.clj" ]]; then
   122‚Üí        local clj_version=$(clojure -version 2>&1 | grep -o '[0-9]\+\.[0-9]\+\.[0-9]\+' | head -1 2>/dev/null || echo "")
   123‚Üí        [[ -n "$clj_version" ]] && lang_info+="${GREEN_FG}Û∞ó§${WHITE_FG} $clj_version "
   124‚Üí    fi
   125‚Üí    
   126‚Üí    # Check for Python
   127‚Üí    if [[ -f "$cwd/pyproject.toml" ]] || [[ -f "$cwd/requirements.txt" ]] || [[ -f "$cwd/setup.py" ]]; then
   128‚Üí        local py_version=$(python3 --version 2>/dev/null | cut -d' ' -f2 || echo "")
   129‚Üí        [[ -n "$py_version" ]] && lang_info+="${YELLOW_FG} ${WHITE_FG}$py_version "
   130‚Üí    fi
   131‚Üí    
   132‚Üí    # Check for Node.js
   133‚Üí    if [[ -f "$cwd/package.json" ]]; then
   134‚Üí        local node_version=$(node --version 2>/dev/null | sed 's/v//' || echo "")
   135‚Üí        [[ -n "$node_version" ]] && lang_info+="${GREEN_FG}‚¨¢${WHITE_FG} $node_version "
   136‚Üí    fi
   137‚Üí    
   138‚Üí    # Check for Java
   139‚Üí    if [[ -f "$cwd/pom.xml" ]] || [[ -f "$cwd/build.gradle" ]]; then
   140‚Üí        local java_version=$(java -version 2>&1 | head -1 | cut -d'"' -f2 | cut -d'.' -f1-2 2>/dev/null || echo "")
   141‚Üí        [[ -n "$java_version" ]] && lang_info+="${YELLOW_FG} ${WHITE_FG}$java_version "
   142‚Üí    fi
   143‚Üí    
   144‚Üí    if [[ -n "$lang_info" ]]; then
   145‚Üí        printf "${BLUE_LIGHT_BG}$lang_info${RESET}"
   146‚Üí    fi
   147‚Üí}
   148‚Üí
   149‚Üí
   150‚Üí# Function to get weather with caching
   151‚Üíget_weather() {
   152‚Üí    local cache_file="/tmp/statusline_weather_cache"
   153‚Üí    local cache_duration=900  # 15 minutes in seconds
   154‚Üí    local current_time=$(date +%s)
   155‚Üí    
   156‚Üí    # Check if cache exists and is still valid
   157‚Üí    if [[ -f "$cache_file" ]]; then
   158‚Üí        local cache_time=$(stat -f %m "$cache_file" 2>/dev/null || stat -c %Y "$cache_file" 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
   159‚Üí        local age=$((current_time - cache_time))
   160‚Üí        
   161‚Üí        if [[ $age -lt $cache_duration ]]; then
   162‚Üí            local cached_weather=$(cat "$cache_file" 2>/dev/null)
   163‚Üí            if [[ -n "$cached_weather" && "$cached_weather" != "error" ]]; then
   164‚Üí                printf "${BLUE_VERY_LIGHT_BG}${WHITE_FG} $cached_weather ${RESET}${PURPLE_BG}\033[38;2;70;150;200m${SEP_RIGHT}${RESET}"
   165‚Üí                return
   166‚Üí            fi
   167‚Üí        fi
   168‚Üí    fi
   169‚Üí    
   170‚Üí    # Fetch fresh weather data with timeout
   171‚Üí    local weather_data=""
   172‚Üí    weather_data=$(timeout 3s curl -s "wttr.in/?format=%c%t+(%f)" 2>/dev/null | tr -d '\n' | sed 's/[[:space:]]*$//')
   173‚Üí    
   174‚Üí    # Validate the response (should contain temperature and not be empty or error message)
   175‚Üí    if [[ -n "$weather_data" && "$weather_data" != *"Unknown"* && "$weather_data" =~ [0-9].*¬∞F ]]; then
   176‚Üí        echo "$weather_data" > "$cache_file"
   177‚Üí        printf "${BLUE_VERY_LIGHT_BG}${WHITE_FG} $weather_data ${RESET}${PURPLE_BG}\033[38;2;70;150;200m${SEP_RIGHT}${RESET}"
   178‚Üí    else
   179‚Üí        # Cache the error state briefly to avoid repeated failed requests
   180‚Üí        echo "error" > "$cache_file"
   181‚Üí    fi
   182‚Üí}
   183‚Üí
   184‚Üí# Function to get current time
   185‚Üíget_time() {
   186‚Üí    local current_time=$(date "+%I:%M:%S %p")
   187‚Üí    printf "${PURPLE_BG}${WHITE_FG} ‚è±Ô∏è$current_time ${RESET}\033[38;2;74;35;90m\uE0B4${RESET}"
   188‚Üí}
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí# Function to get Claude model indicator (prominently displayed)
   191‚Üíget_model_info() {
   192‚Üí    # Keep the full model name for clarity
   193‚Üí    printf "\033[38;2;10;30;50m\uE0B6${RESET}${BLUE_DARKEST_BG}${YELLOW_FG} ü§ñ ${BRIGHT_ORANGE_FG2}$model_name ${RESET}${BLUE_MID_BG}\033[38;2;10;30;50m${SEP_RIGHT}${RESET}"
   194‚Üí}
   195‚Üí
   196‚Üí# Build the complete statusline
   197‚Üístatusline=""
   198‚Üístatusline+="\033[0m"  # Explicit reset at beginning
   199‚Üístatusline+=$(get_model_info)  # Model info after reset
   200‚Üí# statusline+=$(get_user_host)  # Removed user@host display
   201‚Üístatusline+=$(get_directory)
   202‚Üístatusline+=$(get_git_info)
   203‚Üí# statusline+=$(get_language_info)  # Removed programming language section
   204‚Üístatusline+=$(get_weather)
   205‚Üí# Docker context removed as requested
   206‚Üístatusline+=$(get_time)
   207‚Üí
   208‚Üí# Output the statusline
   209‚Üíprintf "$statusline"
   210‚Üí

file.content:
#!/bin/bash

# Claude Code statusline inspired by starship configuration
# Colors match the starship theme with purple, blue, and green accents

# Parse JSON input
input=$(cat)
cwd=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.workspace.current_dir // .cwd')
model_name=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.model.display_name')

# Color definitions (matching starship theme)
PURPLE_BG="\033[48;2;74;35;90m"     # #4A235A
BLUE_DARK_BG="\033[48;2;21;67;96m"  # #154360
BLUE_DARKER_BG="\033[48;2;15;45;70m"  # #0F2D46 - Much darker blue
BLUE_DARKEST_BG="\033[48;2;10;30;50m"  # #0A1E32 - Even darker blue  
BLUE_MID_BG="\033[48;2;26;82;118m"  # #1A5276
BLUE_LIGHT_BG="\033[48;2;45;125;175m" # #2D7DAF - More contrast with mid blue
BLUE_VERY_LIGHT_BG="\033[48;2;70;150;200m" # #4696C8 - Much lighter blue for better contrast
GRAY_BG="\033[48;2;66;73;73m"       # #424949
WHITE_FG="\033[38;2;255;255;255m"   # white text
BOLD_WHITE_FG="\033[1;38;2;255;255;255m" # bold white text
BRIGHT_WHITE_FG="\033[1;38;2;255;255;240m" # slightly warm white
YELLOW_FG="\033[38;2;241;196;15m"   # #F1C40F
GREEN_FG="\033[38;2;88;214;141m"    # #58D68D
ORANGE_FG="\033[38;2;243;156;18m"   # #F39C12
BRIGHT_ORANGE_FG="\033[38;2;255;193;7m" # #FFC107
BOLD_BRIGHT_ORANGE_FG="\033[1;38;2;255;165;0m" # Bold #FFA500
CUSTOM_BRIGHT_FG="\033[1;38;2;235;224;67m" # Bold RGB(235,224,67)
CUSTOM_BRIGHTER_FG="\033[38;2;255;255;100m" # No bold, brighter RGB(255,255,100)
CUSTOM_MAX_BRIGHT_FG="\033[1;38;2;255;255;0m" # Bold max bright yellow
MAX_YELLOW_NO_BOLD="\033[38;2;255;255;0m" # Max bright yellow without bold
FIERY_ORANGE_FG="\033[38;2;255;69;0m" # Fiery orange RGB(255,69,0)
BRIGHT_ORANGE_FG2="\033[38;2;255;140;0m" # More orange, less red RGB(255,140,0)
PALETTE_BRIGHT_YELLOW="\033[1;38;5;226m" # Bold 256-color bright yellow
PALETTE_YELLOW_NO_BOLD="\033[38;5;226m" # 256-color bright yellow without bold
PURPLE_FG="\033[38;2;175;122;197m"  # #AF7AC5
RED_FG="\033[38;2;231;76;60m"       # #E74C3C
RESET="\033[0m"

# Segment separators (Nerd Font powerline glyphs)
SEP_RIGHT=$'\uE0B0'  # Nerd Font powerline right separator
SEP_LEFT=$'\uE0B2'   # Nerd Font powerline left separator
# Alternative rounded separators:
# SEP_RIGHT=$'\uE0B4'  # Nerd Font powerline right separator (rounded)
# SEP_LEFT=$'\uE0B6'   # Nerd Font powerline left separator (rounded)

# Function to get username and hostname
get_user_host() {
    local user=$(whoami)
    local host=$(hostname -s)
    printf "${PURPLE_BG}${WHITE_FG}  ${user}@${host} ${RESET}"
}

# Function to get directory with icon substitutions
get_directory() {
    local dir_path="$cwd"
    local display_path="$dir_path"
    local nu_indicator=""
    
    # Check if we're in a Nubank project
    if [[ "$dir_path" == *"/dev/nu/"* ]]; then
        nu_indicator="üè¶ "
    fi
    
    # Apply substitutions similar to starship config
    display_path=${display_path//$HOME/~}
    display_path=${display_path//Documents/Û∞àô }
    display_path=${display_path//Downloads/ }
    display_path=${display_path//Music/ }
    display_path=${display_path//Pictures/ }
    
    # Truncate long paths
    if [[ ${#display_path} -gt 50 ]]; then
        display_path="‚Ä¶/${display_path##*/}"
    fi
    
    printf "${BLUE_MID_BG}${WHITE_FG} ${nu_indicator}${display_path} ${RESET}${BLUE_LIGHT_BG}\033[38;2;26;82;118m${SEP_RIGHT}${RESET}"
}

# Function to get git information
get_git_info() {
    if [[ ! -d "$cwd/.git" ]] && ! git -C "$cwd" rev-parse --git-dir >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        return
    fi
    
    local branch=$(git -C "$cwd" branch --show-current 2>/dev/null || echo "detached")
    local status_info=""
    
    # Get git status without locks
    local git_status=$(git -C "$cwd" status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)
    if [[ -n "$git_status" ]]; then
        local modified=$(echo "$git_status" | grep -c "^ M\| M\|^M ")
        local added=$(echo "$git_status" | grep -c "^A \|^M ")
        local deleted=$(echo "$git_status" | grep -c "^D \| D")
        local untracked=$(echo "$git_status" | grep -c "^??")
        
        [[ $modified -gt 0 ]] && status_info+="!$modified"
        [[ $added -gt 0 ]] && status_info+="+$added"
        [[ $deleted -gt 0 ]] && status_info+="-$deleted"
        [[ $untracked -gt 0 ]] && status_info+="?$untracked"
    fi
    
    # Get ahead/behind info
    local ahead_behind=$(git -C "$cwd" rev-list --left-right --count HEAD...@{upstream} 2>/dev/null || echo "0 0")
    local ahead=$(echo "$ahead_behind" | cut -d' ' -f1)
    local behind=$(echo "$ahead_behind" | cut -d' ' -f2)
    
    [[ $ahead -gt 0 ]] && status_info+="‚Üë$ahead"
    [[ $behind -gt 0 ]] && status_info+="‚Üì$behind"
    
    printf "${BLUE_LIGHT_BG}${WHITE_FG} Ôêò $branch "
    [[ -n "$status_info" ]] && printf "${WHITE_FG}[$status_info] "
    printf "${RESET}${BLUE_VERY_LIGHT_BG}\033[38;2;45;125;175m${SEP_RIGHT}${RESET}"
}

# Function to detect and show language versions
get_language_info() {
    local lang_info=""
    
    # Check for Clojure (prioritized for this project)
    if [[ -f "$cwd/deps.edn" ]] || [[ -f "$cwd/project.clj" ]]; then
        local clj_version=$(clojure -version 2>&1 | grep -o '[0-9]\+\.[0-9]\+\.[0-9]\+' | head -1 2>/dev/null || echo "")
        [[ -n "$clj_version" ]] && lang_info+="${GREEN_FG}Û∞ó§${WHITE_FG} $clj_version "
    fi
    
    # Check for Python
    if [[ -f "$cwd/pyproject.toml" ]] || [[ -f "$cwd/requirements.txt" ]] || [[ -f "$cwd/setup.py" ]]; then
        local py_version=$(python3 --version 2>/dev/null | cut -d' ' -f2 || echo "")
        [[ -n "$py_version" ]] && lang_info+="${YELLOW_FG} ${WHITE_FG}$py_version "
    fi
    
    # Check for Node.js
    if [[ -f "$cwd/package.json" ]]; then
        local node_version=$(node --version 2>/dev/null | sed 's/v//' || echo "")
        [[ -n "$node_version" ]] && lang_info+="${GREEN_FG}‚¨¢${WHITE_FG} $node_version "
    fi
    
    # Check for Java
    if [[ -f "$cwd/pom.xml" ]] || [[ -f "$cwd/build.gradle" ]]; then
        local java_version=$(java -version 2>&1 | head -1 | cut -d'"' -f2 | cut -d'.' -f1-2 2>/dev/null || echo "")
        [[ -n "$java_version" ]] && lang_info+="${YELLOW_FG} ${WHITE_FG}$java_version "
    fi
    
    if [[ -n "$lang_info" ]]; then
        printf "${BLUE_LIGHT_BG}$lang_info${RESET}"
    fi
}


# Function to get weather with caching
get_weather() {
    local cache_file="/tmp/statusline_weather_cache"
    local cache_duration=900  # 15 minutes in seconds
    local current_time=$(date +%s)
    
    # Check if cache exists and is still valid
    if [[ -f "$cache_file" ]]; then
        local cache_time=$(stat -f %m "$cache_file" 2>/dev/null || stat -c %Y "$cache_file" 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
        local age=$((current_time - cache_time))
        
        if [[ $age -lt $cache_duration ]]; then
            local cached_weather=$(cat "$cache_file" 2>/dev/null)
            if [[ -n "$cached_weather" && "$cached_weather" != "error" ]]; then
                printf "${BLUE_VERY_LIGHT_BG}${WHITE_FG} $cached_weather ${RESET}${PURPLE_BG}\033[38;2;70;150;200m${SEP_RIGHT}${RESET}"
                return
            fi
        fi
    fi
    
    # Fetch fresh weather data with timeout
    local weather_data=""
    weather_data=$(timeout 3s curl -s "wttr.in/?format=%c%t+(%f)" 2>/dev/null | tr -d '\n' | sed 's/[[:space:]]*$//')
    
    # Validate the response (should contain temperature and not be empty or error message)
    if [[ -n "$weather_data" && "$weather_data" != *"Unknown"* && "$weather_data" =~ [0-9].*¬∞F ]]; then
        echo "$weather_data" > "$cache_file"
        printf "${BLUE_VERY_LIGHT_BG}${WHITE_FG} $weather_data ${RESET}${PURPLE_BG}\033[38;2;70;150;200m${SEP_RIGHT}${RESET}"
    else
        # Cache the error state briefly to avoid repeated failed requests
        echo "error" > "$cache_file"
    fi
}

# Function to get current time
get_time() {
    local current_time=$(date "+%I:%M:%S %p")
    printf "${PURPLE_BG}${WHITE_FG} ‚è±Ô∏è$current_time ${RESET}\033[38;2;74;35;90m\uE0B4${RESET}"
}

# Function to get Claude model indicator (prominently displayed)
get_model_info() {
    # Keep the full model name for clarity
    printf "\033[38;2;10;30;50m\uE0B6${RESET}${BLUE_DARKEST_BG}${YELLOW_FG} ü§ñ ${BRIGHT_ORANGE_FG2}$model_name ${RESET}${BLUE_MID_BG}\033[38;2;10;30;50m${SEP_RIGHT}${RESET}"
}

# Build the complete statusline
statusline=""
statusline+="\033[0m"  # Explicit reset at beginning
statusline+=$(get_model_info)  # Model info after reset
# statusline+=$(get_user_host)  # Removed user@host display
statusline+=$(get_directory)
statusline+=$(get_git_info)
# statusline+=$(get_language_info)  # Removed programming language section
statusline+=$(get_weather)
# Docker context removed as requested
statusline+=$(get_time)

# Output the statusline
printf "$statusline"

I can see you already have a well-configured statusLine script that's inspired by your Starship configuration. The current setup converts your colorful Starship theme into a Claude Code status line with:

- **Model information** (prominently displayed with orange text)
- **Directory path** with Nubank project indicator üè¶
- **Git branch and status** information
- **Weather** with caching
- **Current time**

The script matches your Starship color scheme with purple, blue, and green accents, and uses Nerd Font powerline separators.

Your settings are already properly configured in `/Users/christian.romney/.claude/settings.json` to use this custom statusline script.

- **Colors**: Matches your Starship purple/blue theme

**Important note**: For any future status line changes, you'll need to use this "statusline-setup" agent. You can ask Claude to continue making changes to the status line configuration as needed.

message.content: Caveat: The messages below were generated by the user while running local commands. DO NOT respond to these messages or otherwise consider them in your response unless the user explicitly asks you to.
